boat.full_description: Traditionally a Scow has had only a mainsail and this is a requirement when racing single-handed. The Lymington River Scow Class Rules, however, allow a jib to be used when racing with a crew and, if the combined weight of the helm and crew exceeds 22 stone (140 kgs), a spinnaker is also allowed. Anna 2 has a 1sq m jib, and a 6.5 sq m spinnaker

handicap_data.peformance_details:
o Main 7.0 sq m
        o Jib 1.0 sq m
        o Spinnaker6.5 sq m
    Weight: 100 kgs 

Traditionally a Scow has had only a mainsail and this is a requirement when racing single-handed. The Lymington River Scow Class Rules, allow a jib (1 sq m) to be used when racing with a crew and, if the combined weight of the helm and crew exceeds 22 stone (140 kgs), a spinnaker (6.5 sq m) is also allowed.

boat.name: Anna 2
